Class Polynomial

java.lang.Object
  Polynomial

public class Polynomial
extends java.lang.Object

A class to model polynomial expressions in a linked list data structure.

Version:
CSC 143 Winter 15
Author:
Matthew Staehely

Polynomial

public Polynomial(Polynomial p)
Constructor for class Polynomial. Creates a deep copy of a polynomial expression, does not modify original.

Parameters:
p - the polynomial object to be copied.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if passed Polynomial is null.

Polynomial

public Polynomial(java.lang.String s)
Constructor of class Polynomial.

Parameters:
s - String which represents the polynomial expression. Must be composed of double/integer or integer/integer pairs.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if non-numbers are passed to constructor.

Adds a term to the polynomial expression.

Parameters:
coef - the coefficient of the new term.
exp - the exponent of the new term.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a negative exponent value is passed.

deleteTerm

public double deleteTerm(int exp)
Deletes a term from the polynomial expression and returns that term's coefficient.

Parameters:
the - exponent of the term to be deleted.
Returns:
the coefficient of the deleted term, 0.0 if that term does not exist.

derivative

public Polynomial derivative()
Calculates the derivative of the polynomial.

Returns:
the derived polynomial expression.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if a null polynomial is attempted to be derived.

description

public java.lang.String description()
Returns a String representation of this polynomial. The format is in ascending order of degree, beginning with constant term if such exists.

Returns:
a String representation of this polynomial.
